title: Empathetic Decision-Making Workshop for Remote Mathematics Education Designers: Optimization Strategies Based on Weighted Evaluation Matrices

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational knowledge in mathematics curriculum design (linear programming, optimization theory), experience operating LMS, and basic statistical analysis skills
context.additional_context: Need to strengthen empathic design capabilities in math content development by mathematically modeling learner needs (individualized learning paths) and educational resource constraints (classroom/budget/staffing). Balancing mathematical optimization techniques with learner-centered design in the educational planning process.

learning_goals: Develop ≥3 learner personas reflecting mathematical needs (computational skills, problem-solving types, conceptual understanding) using an empathetic design framework

Combine qualitative interviews with mathematical modeling techniques to identify ≥5 learner requirements (time allocation, budget constraints, resource utilization) and integrate them into design documents

Within two weeks, learners analyze stakeholder needs (faculty/students/institutions) for three real-world cases converting constraints (time/budget/resources) into mathematical variables (e.g., classroom scheduling optimization, scholarship allocation algorithms, curriculum redesign simulations), and propose decision-making strategies meeting ≥80% satisfaction using weighted evaluation matrices (linear programming-based)
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
